page.title: 16Steeple Aston
page.content: The Steeple Aston school observes traditions such as May Day with maypole dancing and the choice of May Queen and Jack of the Green. Sir Francis Page was a judge whose memorial is in Steeple Aston church. It is said that the ghosts of a hundred widows of men hanged for theft by order of Judge Page change into owls on midsummer night and put Judge Page's ghost into a beer barrel which they chase round Middle Aston pond. A 'folly' was designed by William Kent in 1740 and built in a field in this area. It was designed as an 'eyecatcher' to be viewed from Rousham House.
